1.title: Shady Beginnings
1.plot: Errin gives Jordan and LaNay her blessing on their relationship, but it doesn't go as expected; Rob moves to LA and Jordan and Moe throw him a farewell party; Kallandra meets a new co-worker.

2.title: Apologies Not Accepted
2.plot: Errin refuses to apologize or accept LaNay's apology, so Jordan steps in; Moe tries to make up with Shawna for their relationship's past.

3.title: Fuss, Fight, & Talent Night
3.plot: Shawna takes Errin to a spoken word event to get her mind off of the LaNay situation. Moe hatches a plan to get Shawna to give up on her 90-day rule.

4.title: Miss Me a Little When I'm Gone
4.plot: Jordan offers Moe some advice; Errin and Mecca get closer; Shawna makes another attempt to end the feud between Errin and LaNay; Kallandra bumps into Jermaine outside of work.

5.title: Sweet N Sour Happy Hour
5.plot: LaNay and Errin make amends; Shawna and Moe's relationship hits a rough patch; Kallandra is unsure about her feelings for Jermaine; Errin learns more about Mecca.

6.title: Why Are You Here?
6.plot: Shawna is furious when she catches Moe with another woman; things heat up between Kallandra and Jermaine; LaNay hosts a game night for the yuppies.

7.title: Happy Holidays
7.plot: Errin throws an ugly sweater party as the yuppies prepare for the holiday season.

8.title: 24 Days of Christmas
8.plot: Paying homage to "24," Errin's Christmas party turns out to be disastrous for the entire Yuppie clique.

1.title: You from the Urrea Now
1.plot: From awkward first dates, to maintaining current and new friendships, these Young Urban Professionals learn that their drama runs high, and their gossip spreads fast.

2.title: She Gots Your Thirsty
2.plot: Happy Hour in the city is anything but happy when Errin runs into a familiar face; Deanna is introduced to the rest of the yuppies.

3.title: Love Potion Number 50
3.plot: A drunken Deanna wakes up to a stranger in her house; after the club fight, Errin's mom stops by to give some words of "wisdom."

4.title: Catching Feelings
4.plot: Jordan considers making his move on a newly single Errin. Deanna and Moe warm up to each other, much to the disgust of Kallandra.

5.title: 0-100 Real Quick
5.plot: Tension between Jordan and Kenny flares after Errin gives Kenny a second chance; Deanna investigates why Moe stood her up.

6.title: Date Night
6.plot: Kenny and Moe take Errin and Deanna on dates to get themselves out of the doghouse; Jordan and Rob take LaNay and Kallandra on friendly dates.

7.title: What's Beef
7.plot: Jordan and LaNay feel pressured to hide their new love from Errin; Rob is jealous of Moe's luck with the ladies; Kallandra and Deanna meet face-to-face.

8.title: The Plot Thickens
8.plot: After LaNay and Jordan go M.I.A., Errin decides to get everyone together for game night. Deanna goes to her first Gogo.

imdb.plot outline: D.C. Yuppies is a scripted web-series that follows the lives of seven young urban professionals as they navigate their promising careers, relationships, and the exciting nightlife of the Washington, DC Metro area, affectionately known as DMV. But in an area this small, the drama runs high and the gossip spreads fast! Errin is the chair of a high school English department that brings her quiet, book nerd coworker, Deanna, to her first happy hour. It's there that we meet the rest of Errin's clique: Jordan - the gentleman, LaNay - the one-woman rumor mill, Moe - the ladies' man, Kallandra - the sophisti-ratchet, and Rob - the nice guy that always finishes last.
imdb.title: D.C. Yuppies
plot: Young urban professionals in the District of Columbia balancing their careers, relationships, and the exciting nightlife, learn that their drama runs high, and their gossip spreads fast!

_D.C. Yuppies_ (qv) is a scripted web-series that follows the lives of seven young urban professionals as they navigate their promising careers, relationships, and the exciting nightlife of the Washington, DC Metro area, affectionately known as DMV. But in an area this small, the drama runs high and the gossip spreads fast! Errin is the chair of a high school English department that brings her quiet, book nerd coworker, Deanna, to her first happy hour. It's there that we meet the rest of Errin's clique: Jordan - the gentleman, LaNay - the one-woman rumor mill, Moe - the ladies' man, Kallandra - the sophisti-ratchet, and Rob - the nice guy that always finishes last.::Brandon E. Hairston

Sophisticated, yet flashy. Refined, but arrogant. A yuppie is a Young Urban Professional that has achieved a certain level of success for such a short time in their career. But don't mistake a yuppie for all work and no play. As yuppies check goals off their lists, they celebrate with happy hours behind the velvet rope (bottle service, of course). They are the clique that everyone envies, but secretly wishes to be a part of, until they're in.::Brandon E. Hairston
